column1: The skin will: - Blister - Turn red - Usually swell - Usually be painful Treat a burn like a major burn (call your doctor) if it is: - From a fire, an electrical wire or socket, or chemicals - Larger than 2 inches - On the hand, foot, face, groin, buttocks, hip, knee, ankle, shoulder, elbow, or wrist
Some antibiotic ointments can cause an allergic reaction.
Call your doctor if you have signs of infection: - Increased pain - Redness - Swelling - Oozing or pus - Fever - Swollen lymph nodes - Red streak from the burn
